title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
jvelociter left at 00:14 (Quit: jvelociter  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 00:30  
jvelociter left at 00:31 (Client Quit  
bblfish - (00:46): is there a way of adding <link elements to the header from a velocity script?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:49): Meaning the html <head>, not easily.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:51): You can take over the entire page by writing to $response.getOutputStream  
bblfish - (00:58): thanks. I was thinking of adding the following to the header, which would give everyone an openid  
bblfish - (00:58): <link rel="openid.server" href="http://openid4.me/index.php" />  
bblfish - (00:58): <link rel="openid2.provider openid.server" href="http://openid4.me/index.php"/>  
bblfish - (00:58): <link rel="meta" type="application/rdf+xml" title="FOAF" href="your\_foaf\_file"/>  
bblfish - (00:59): but there are two problems:  
bblfish - (00:59): - the home page urls are too long to be useful OpenIds  
bblfish - (00:59): - and we have rdf pages not rdfa ones  
bblfish - (00:59): (so I think we'll need to ask openid4.me to tweak their code first anyway)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:01): I turned up some interesting signing related info (sent mail to the dev list.)  
bblfish - (01:02): yes, just answering it  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:48): Interesting, If you can put up with adding a parameter to the URL like page?oid=1  then the velocity can return whatever it wants (even non-html mime type)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:49): (easily)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:51): As far as xwiki.org/p/user is concerned, that would be a different servlet (like xmlrpc or rest uses) Clearly you would have total control of the page that way.

vmassol - (09:01): for ex: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/InternationalizingApplications#HUsing20the20static20Resource20Bundles

kibahop - (09:04): If I have a class in a page to store some properties, how do I access these with xmlrpc (or REST). Any documentation? FAQ? Thanks.  
vmassol - (09:05): kibahop: there are extensive xmlrpc documentation at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/XMLRPC have you checked there?  
SvenDowideit left at 09:05 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
SvenDowideit\_ is now known as SvenDowideit ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
vmassol - (09:06): kibahop: also why don't you try autocomplete on XWikiXmlRpcClient in your IDE?  
vmassol - (09:06): that will give you all methods available  
vmassol left at 09:14 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 09:16  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 09:19  
kibahop - (09:22): vmassol: Thanks for the hint on IDE. I read the above doc, but it's still unclear to me if it's possible to access one's own class via xmlrpc (or REST).  
vmassol - (09:23): kibahop: have you checked XWikiXmlRpcClient as I mentioned?  
vmassol - (09:24): if you do you'll have your answer and a lot more  
vmassol - (09:27): (give a man a fish and you'll feed him for a day, teach him to fish and you'll feed him forever… or something like that ;))  
kibahop - (09:27): vmassol: I'll swallow that :-)  
vmassol - (09:28): seriously look at XWikiXmlRpcClient and you'll see all the capabiities  
vmassol - (09:28): if you want to see the source, it's here: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-xmlrpc/xwiki-xmlrpc-client/src/main/java/org/xwiki/xmlrpc/XWikiXmlRpcClient.java

sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 13:06  
sdumitriu - (13:12): vmassol, tmortagne: Why is only syntax 1.0 available on myxwiki.org?  
vmassol - (13:12): is the config ok?  
vmassol - (13:12): I see both available  
vmassol - (13:13): for ex: http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Main/WebHome?&editor=wiki  
sdumitriu - (13:13): Maybe the panel needs to be reimported  
vmassol - (13:13): sdumitriu: do you have a link?  
vmassol - (13:14): panels are fine for me  
vmassol - (13:14): (at least on the main wiki)  
sdumitriu - (13:15): Yep, Panels.DocumentInformation must be reimported  
vmassol - (13:15): what's the pb?  
sdumitriu - (13:15): Try on any other wiki except the main one and the incubator  
sdumitriu - (13:16): The problem is that when editing the document only xwiki/1.0 is displayed  
vmassol - (13:16): I see both  
vmassol - (13:16): http://playground.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Panels/QuickLinks  
vmassol - (13:17): why do you think a reimport will help?  
sdumitriu - (13:17): Strange...  
sdumitriu - (13:17): I saw that on the incubator a minute ago  
sdumitriu - (13:18): OK, I reverted the panel  
sdumitriu - (13:18): See: http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Main/NewDoc?&editor=wiki  
vmassol - (13:19): so the pb is when creating new pages?  
sdumitriu - (13:20): And the same happens on praline, pom, gsoc  
vmassol - (13:21): it's possible it's related to the pb I fixed yesterday  
vmassol - (13:21): checking locally  
sdumitriu - (13:21): XAPANELS-117  
sdumitriu - (13:22): "Use the new Rendering Script Service API to get the list of available syntaxes in the Document Information Panel"  
sdumitriu - (13:22): Maybe the old panel version doesn't work anymore  
sdumitriu - (13:22): (the one before 117)  
vmassol - (13:23): indeed  
vmassol - (13:23): it doesn't  
vmassol - (13:23): I made the new panel work with an old core but not the other way around  
vmassol - (13:24): so yes it needs to be reimported to work  
anu86 left at 13:25 (Quit: Page closed  
vmassol - (13:25): we could decide to reintroduce a backward compat method if we wanted  
vmassol - (13:25): (if we think it's too much of a pain to ask users to upgrade this panel)

samuel2 joined #xwiki at 15:18  
silviar - (15:20): Hi! When I convert a box from 1.0 to 2.0, if the box has inverted commas in it the text after the commas (inlcuding the comma) dissapears  
silviar - (15:20): e.g.  
silviar - (15:20): "When creating "Internationalization Document Bundles", you should avoid naming the pages with names that include spaces. For example, a document name of Main.My Messages could cause issues, instead, use Main.MyMessages"  
silviar - (15:20): becomes  
silviar - (15:20): "When creating"  
silviar - (15:20): is this a known issue?  
vmassol - (15:21): by comman you mean quote?  
silviar - (15:21): I've come accross this while working on xwiki.org  
vmassol - (15:21): s/comman/comma/  
silviar - (15:21): yes  
vmassol - (15:21): what was the origianl content?  
vmassol - (15:22): you mentioned a box but I don't see it in your paste above  
silviar - (15:22): this was the content in the box  
silviar - (15:22): When creating "Internationalization Document Bundles", you should avoid naming the pages with names that include spaces. For example, a document name of Main.My Messages could cause issues, instead, use Main.MyMessages  
vmassol - (15:22): what box?  
vmassol - (15:22): what is a box?  
silviar - (15:23): a macro :)  
silviar - (15:23): here http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/InternationalizingApplications  
vmassol - (15:23): you're talking about the toc macro?  
silviar - (15:24): the info  
silviar - (15:24): {{info}}  
silviar - (15:24): When creating  
silviar - (15:24): {{/info}}  
vmassol - (15:24): what I don't understa,d  
vmassol - (15:24): is how you could have:  
vmassol - (15:24): #info("hello "world"")  
sdumitriu - (15:24): silviar: Was it like this before?  
sdumitriu - (15:24): #info('When creating "Internationalization Document Bundles", you should avoid naming the pages with names that include spaces. For example, a document name of Main.My Messages could cause issues, instead, use Main.MyMessages')  
vmassol - (15:24): yes that what you had before?  
vmassol - (15:24): s/yes/is/  
silviar - (15:25): I didn't look at the syntax before, but there was the whole content  
silviar - (15:25): I can revert the doc and paste you the syntax  
vmassol - (15:26): don't revert  
silviar - (15:26): ok  
vmassol - (15:26): sdumitriu: does velocity support this?  
vmassol - (15:26): (quotes inside quotes)  
vmassol - (15:26): I would have said it doesn't  
silviar - (15:26): I've been working around it by pasting in the old content, so the result is the same; but I thought I would let you know about the issue  
sdumitriu - (15:28): No  
vmassol - (15:31): silviar: it's a pb indeed but it's hard to fix  
vmassol - (15:31): since the original content was wrong in the first place  
vmassol - (15:32): I'm not sure the ROI of fixing it is high enough  
vmassol - (15:32): tmortagne would know better  
nickless joined #xwiki at 15:35  
kibahop left #xwiki at 15:35  
florinciu left at 15:36 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
vmassol - (15:38): silviar: you're fixing http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/InternationalizingApplications ?  
vmassol - (15:38): (so indeed for now you need to careful when converting pages that have " inside #warning, #error and #info macros)  
vmassol - (15:39): btw I've seen that you've broken a few comments too in your conversions due to errors  in the converter/original content  
silviar - (15:39): yes, I double check all content after I make the changes  
silviar - (15:39): to make sure pages look the same  
vmassol - (15:39): make sure you double check comments too  
vmassol - (15:39): :)  
vmassol - (15:40): if you check the watchlist sent yesterday you'll find some errors  
silviar - (15:40): I didn't check the comments :)  
vmassol - (15:40): comments are converted too  
vmassol - (15:40): from syntax 1.0 to 2.0  
silviar - (15:41): is there a way I can edit them?  
vmassol - (15:41): yes  
vmassol - (15:41): they are objects  
silviar - (15:41): ok, found it  
silviar - (15:41): thx  
silviar - (15:42): I will go back and fix once I am done with this doc  
tmortagne - (15:48): silviar: could you create a jira issue about 1.0/2.0 converter with your 1.0 content, i will look at it quickly and first try to understand how it can work in 1.0  
silviar - (15:49): doing it now  
tmortagne - (15:49): thanks  
silviar - (15:49): np  
silviar - (15:59): XWIKI-4970

tmortagne - (16:05): mflorea: ok

jvdrean - (16:11): I'm looking at it  
vmassol - (16:12): thx

jvdrean - (16:34): #if("$!request.xpage" == 'plain' && "$!request.outputSyntax" == 'plain')

bblfish - (16:38): vmassol: you suggested using extensions to add <link reltations to the header of an html page. But I just see a way to add either javascript or css.  
vmassol - (16:39): or links  
vmassol - (16:39): they're not documented I think  
vmassol - (16:39): but it's the same

vmassol - (16:40): hmmm  
vmassol - (16:40): wait  
vmassol - (16:40): they're not activated apparently

vmassol - (16:43): bblfish: see http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XSKINX-17  
bblfish - (16:44): thanks, do you know how I get Adium to signal to me when someone mentions my name?  
vmassol - (16:44): bblfish: Advanced tab  
vmassol - (16:45): then Mentions  
bblfish - (16:45): ah cool thanks, I was looking at Events  
vmassol - (16:45): Events too  
vmassol - (16:45): "You are mentioned" event  
vmassol - (16:45): make sure you choose for group chats  
vmassol - (16:46): then play a sound  
bblfish - (16:48): got it, thanks  
hjs left at 16:48 (Remote host closed the connection  
bblfish - (16:50): great. I really like Adium now. It's really improved over the last year  
tmortagne - (16:58): silviar: would be better if you could give the exact 1.0 code as an example between {code}{code} in the issue so that i can make sure i don't make mistake when i try to reproduce it  
silviar - (17:00): this would mean rolling back the page to get the code  
vmassol - (17:00): silviar: cannot we access the content of a previous version?  
vmassol - (17:01): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/viewrev/DevGuide/InternationalizingApplications?rev=5.2&viewer=code  
vmassol - (17:02): ah so it was escaped  
vmassol - (17:02): not exactly what you said! :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:02): Along the same line: why does viewer=code swap ' for ` instead of html encoding it?  
vmassol - (17:02): #info("When creating \"Internationalization Document Bundles\", you should avoid naming the pages with names that include spaces.  For example, a document name of Main.My Messages could cause issues, instead, use Main.MyMessages")  
tmortagne - (17:02): silviar: noty the whole page  
tmortagne - (17:02): i mean the exact content to reproduce the issue  
tmortagne - (17:02): instead of an explanation  
vmassol - (17:03): tmortagne: I've pasted it  
silviar - (17:03): I know what you mean, I just didn't know how to get the content :)  
silviar - (17:03): I will update the issue  
silviar - (17:03): thx  
tmortagne - (17:03): vmassol: ok but it wasn't just for me, it would be good to have that in jira for someone having the same issue  
tmortagne - (17:03): silviar: ok thanks  
silviar - (17:03): np  
vmassol - (17:04): CalebJamesDeLisl: a bug?  
tmortagne - (17:04): #info("When creating \"Internationalization Document Bundles\", you should avoid naming the pages with names that include spaces.  For example, a document name of Main.My Messages could cause issues, instead, use Main.MyMessages") should be support that's weird  
silviar - (17:04): I have it from Vincent, thx  
tmortagne - (17:04): i'm pretty sure i have test for that and i'm sure \" is supported in my velocity parser  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:04): It's always been that way AFAIK.  
vmassol - (17:04): that doesn't mean it's not buggy :)  
tmortagne - (17:05): i said it was weird not impossible ;)  
vmassol - (17:05): (responding to caleb)  
tmortagne - (17:05): ok :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:06): If nobody claims the viewer=code  s/'/`/   "feature" then I'll create an issue for it.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:06): And a test :)  
vmassol - (17:06): my memory doesn't go that far in xwiki's history  
vmassol - (17:07): you're reaching the point where only ludovic might have an inkling of why it was done that way…;)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:07): Mail to the list?  
vmassol - (17:08): IMO a direct jira issue is good  
vmassol - (17:08): up to you  
vmassol - (17:08): mail won't harm, you choose  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:09): Mail first and if no reply then the issue.  
tmortagne - (17:09): CalebJamesDeLisl: anyway if it's an issue for you i think it need it deserve to be in jira even if we close as worn't fix later  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:10): Good point, It would be nice to be able to copy-paste from old versions.  
vmassol - (17:10): +1  
silviar left at 17:19 (Quit: Leaving.  
bblfish - (17:22): vmassol, so I'd add this to a javascript extension  
bblfish - (17:22): {{velocity}}  
bblfish - (17:22): $xwiki.linkx.use("http://openid4.me/index.php", {'rel': 'openid2.provider openid.server'})  
bblfish - (17:22): {{/velocity}}  
bblfish - (17:22): ?  
vmassol - (17:23): no  
vmassol - (17:23): this is not a js extension  
vmassol - (17:23): nothing to do with js  
bblfish - (17:23): ah ok  
bblfish - (17:23): a stylesheet?  
vmassol - (17:23): sdumitriu: how do we use link extensions?  
sdumitriu - (17:24): It's not enabled  
vmassol - (17:24): how hard is it to enable it?  
sdumitriu - (17:25): Just add a html comment  
vmassol - (17:25): how does it find link extensions?  
vmassol - (17:25): since there are no objects for it

lucaa - (23:22): caleb: that's because group by doesn't really work with more columns, as far as this is saying http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.1/en/select.html as far as I remember, and if you think about it it doesn't really make sense  
lucaa - (23:23): you need to have a value that would create partitions in the result set, if you want to use both you should create a single value of them using an expression (concatenation for example)
